Sizing a Control While You Add It
To size a control while you add it
Select a control in the [Toolbox Window](/visualstudio/ide/reference/toolbox).
Place your cursor (which appears as cross hairs) where you want the upper-left corner of the new control to be on your dialog box.
Click and hold down the mouse button to anchor the upper-left corner of your control on the dialog box, then drag the cursor to the right and down until the control is the size you want.
You can actually anchor any of the four corners of the control you're drawing.
This procedure used the upper-left corner as an example.
Release the mouse button.
The control settles onto the dialog box in the size you specified.
You can resize the control after dropping it onto the dialog box by moving the sizing handles on the border of the control.
For more information, see [Sizing Individual Controls](../mfc/sizing-individual-controls.md).
